intro: Sphenodesme racemosa var. racemosa, commonly known as the racemose sphenodesme, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit and produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically features palmately lobed leaves with a hairy underside. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its floral structure is notable for its racemose arrangement, which contributes to its common name.
